intro: Forstera sedifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf forstera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Forstera sedifolia thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
